edu.purdue.cc.sysnet.util
Class SplitSpectrum

java.lang.Object
  edu.purdue.cc.sysnet.util.Spectrum
      edu.purdue.cc.sysnet.util.SplitSpectrum
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, PaintScale
public class SplitSpectrum
extends Spectrum

A Class for mapping a color value to each value in a Range, based on the visible spectrum. This implementation splits the spectrum on 0, and returns colors in the lower end of the spectrum for values < 0, and the upper end for values > 0.

Method Detail

normalize

protected float normalize(float value)
Normalizes the value based on a split spectrum model mirrored in positive and negative. Positive values for value return a number between 0.5 and 1, Negative values return a number between 0 and 0.5.

Overrides:
normalize in class Spectrum
Parameters:
value - The value to be normalized.
Returns:
The normalized value.

inRange

protected boolean inRange(float value)
Returns true if the value is contained in this Spectrum's Range.

Overrides:
inRange in class Spectrum
Parameters:
value - The value to be checked.
Returns:
Whether the value is in range or not.

Creates a copy of this Object.

clone in class Spectrum
Returns:
A new SplitSpectrum with the same Range.
